feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 11 at 4:55AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AREAS OF BLACK ICE POSSIBLE THIS MORNING... Temperatures this morning have fallen to or slightly below the freezing mark across the Anchorage Bowl and Matanuska Valley. Areas of black ice area possible this morning due to the combination of cold morning temperatures and wet roadways from the rain/snow mix yesterday. Temperatures should climb back above

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued October 11 at 4:38AM AKDT until October 13 at 7:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING FOR THOMPSON PASS... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of up to 8 to 16 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Thompson Pass.

entry.title: Winter Storm Watch issued October 11 at 4:38AM AKDT until October 13 at 7:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches possible, with locally higher amounts along the Richardson Highway south of Tonsina. * WHERE...Copper River Basin.

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued October 10 at 2:27PM AKDT until October 13 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 10 at 2:22PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Significant Snow Southeast of Delta Junction Starting Tonight... Significant snow will develop southeast of Delta Junction tonight and continue through tomorrow morning. Between 1 and 4 inches of snow are possible southeast of Delta Junction, with the heaviest snow from Dry Creek to Tok and south of Donnelly Dome. South of Trims DOT Camp, north winds gusting to 30 mph will cause areas of
entry.cap:areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Eastern Alaska Range; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 10 at 2:07PM AKDT until October 12 at 4:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TUESDAY TO 4 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches. Wind gusts up to 50 mph causing blowing snow will reduce visibility to one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Western Arctic Coast.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 10 at 2:07PM AKDT until October 12 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TUESDAY TO 10 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 3 inches. Wind gusts up to 50 mph causing blowing snow will reduce visibility to one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...Northern Arctic Coast.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued October 10 at 1:17PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, other low-lying areas and flood-prone locations. Isolated landslides are possible in areas of steep terrain.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 11 at 8:45AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...PATCHY DENSE FOG THIS MORNING BEFORE 1000 AM... Patchy dense fog this morning along parts of the interior of the Lower Hudson Valley and Southern Connecticut, especially in the valleys, will reduce visibilities down to a quarter mile or less. The fog is expected to dissipate by or shortly before 1000 AM.

entry.summary: ...PATCHY DENSE FOG THIS MORNING BEFORE 1000 AM... Patchy dense fog this morning along parts of the interior of the Lower Hudson Valley and Southern Connecticut, especially in the valleys, will reduce visibilities down to a quarter mile or less. The fog is expected to dissipate by or shortly before 1000 AM.
